abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Sunsari Morang
            Headworks Project for Nepal was satisfactory. The project
            achieved its main physical objectives, institutional
            development has been partially achieved, sustainability is
            uncertain, and the performance of both the Bank and Borrower
            was satisfactory. Several lessons can be learned from this
            project. First, for important infrastructure projects like
            SMHP, the arrangements for procurement and a management plan
            of ICB contracts should be agreed upon and finalized before
            credit effectiveness. Second, organizational arrangements
            for the operation and maintenance of the infrastructure
            installed under the project must be finalized and in place
            prior to the commencement of commissioning and take over.
            Third, limiting turnover of key project personnel is
            critical when dealing with ICB contracts to avoid disputes,
            penalties, and delinquencies in contractual obligations.
            Fourth, the success of operation and sustainability of
            infrastructure projects depends on the physical soundness of
            structures, as well as the project's social and
            organizational responsiveness to the concerns of all
            stakeholders. Finally, O&M arrangements should be in
            place and tested for at least one year before the closure of
            the credit.
